definition: to tease/to provoke/to play with (a child, animal etc)
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
lane/alley
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with

sentences.english: Then Joyce finally explained that Jessica's teasing bothered her.
sentences.chinese: 最後喬依絲終於解釋說潔西卡的逗弄讓她很受不了。

sentences.english: It's cruel to make fun of a cripple.
My mother, though, wanted him to stop teasing the moment my reaction was clear.
sentences.chinese: 但是我母親顯然想阻止父親繼續逗弄我。

sentences.english: Jessica meant nothing by her teasing and thought it shouldn't bother Joyce.
sentences.chinese: 她以爲自己的逗弄沒什麼，不會傷害到喬依絲。

sentences.english: I have deserted also his little half-sister.
sentences.chinese: 休小時候總愛逗弄她的小妹妹。

sentences.english: The shrill screams from tickled girls.
sentences.chinese: 被逗弄的女孩們的尖脆叫喊。

sentences.english: For two more weeks, Mother clucked, smiled and held Jacob.
sentences.chinese: 有兩個多星期，媽媽微笑，抱着雅克布，逗弄他。

sentences.english: The boy would come into the room and tantalize the dog with his feed.
sentences.chinese: 那個男孩會到房間裏拿狗食逗弄狗。

sentences.english: Use George Bush or Others and joust your way through the competition to get the vote.
sentences.chinese: 布什使用或其他與逗弄，通過競爭的方法來表決。

sentences.english: He teased the dog by pulling its tail.
They bantered him on the subject of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 他們在婚姻問題上逗弄他。

sentences.english: It's too bad of you to tease the child like that.
sentences.chinese: 你那樣逗弄小孩真讓人感到痛心。

chuckle

to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to caress/to fondle/to look after (tenderly)/affectionate care
to move to and fro (with hand, foot, stick etc)/to fiddle with/to stir up
to make fun of
to tease/to make fun of/to provoke/to stir up (trouble)
to tantalize/to lead on/to tease
to move back and forth/to fiddle with
to tease/to play tricks on
to stroke/to caress
